parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.21

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Waypoints

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the position of a selected waypoint of a given group. Waypoints include only those which were placed in the mission editor.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''getWPPos''' [group, index]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [group, index]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> group: [[Group]] - the group/unit, of which you want to select a waypoint

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> index: [[Number]] - 0 equals the starting position of the group.<br>
The number used in this and other waypoint commands is ''one more'' than the one displayed in the waypoint window in the editor. (i.e. if the editor labeled a WP <tt>"0:MOVE"</tt> the you would have to use <tt>getWPPos [grp,1]</tt> to access this particular WP)

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - format [[Position3D]]. 
The returned position equals [0,0,0], if the selected waypoint doesn't exist.
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[_group1,1] [[setWPPos]] [200,600,0];<br>_pos <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [[getWPPos]] [_group1,1];</code>

returns [200,600,0]

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setWPPos]]
</value></part></template>


[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.99|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
